content.text: Fixed an issue where the handleGoogle function lost the apiKey.
Merged the 'develop' branch into 'main' to synchronize updates.
Fixed typos and updated functions in documentation.
Updated model configuration to be read from the character file.
Fixed unit test failures for models and parsing.
Fixed a Twitter logging bug.
Set package publish access to public.
Fixed typos in plugins documentation.
Removed remnant files and folders.
Added missing version property to package.json.
Cleaned JSON before normalization.
Bumped version to 0.25.6-alpha.1.
Fixed Docker and TypeScript issues.

categories.title: Recent Plugin Updates and Additions in ElizaOS

content.text: A fix was applied to the `plugin-solana-v2` package.json file to correct a JSON formatting issue. The issue was caused by an improperly formatted property name, which has now been resolved.

A new plugin, `plugin-vana`, was added to ElizaOS. This plugin enables the transfer of VANA tokens between accounts. The update includes detailed testing steps, environment variable setup, and deployment instructions.
The `plugin-apro` was renamed to `plugin-ATTPs` to better reflect its functionality. This change involved updating all related references in the codebase.

A new plugin, `plugin-elfa-ai`, was introduced to integrate Elfa AI's Social Analytics API into ElizaOS. This plugin provides real-time social media analytics, including mentions, trending tokens, and Twitter account statistics.

A new plugin, `plugin-bonsai`, was added to ElizaOS. This plugin enables agents to create and promote tokens, as well as provide analysis. It integrates with the Bonsai platform and includes updates to `client-lens` and `client-farcaster` for improved functionality.

A new `Safe` plugin was introduced, allowing smart account creation and deployment using the Safe Protocol Kit. This feature enhances the AI agent framework by enabling secure and efficient account management.
A new `OKX DEX` plugin was added to ElizaOS, enabling token swaps on Solana. The plugin integrates with the OKX DEX API to fetch quotes, execute swaps, and retrieve chain and token data.

A new `State of Mika` plugin was introduced, integrating the State of Mika AI engine into ElizaOS. This plugin provides AI-driven inferences such as image recognition, content scraping, market data retrieval, and cryptocurrency analytics.

A dynamic plugin loading feature was merged into ElizaOS, improving the flexibility of plugin management. This update ensures that plugins can be dynamically loaded without requiring manual intervention.
A new version of ElizaOS has been released, bumping the version to 0.25.6-alpha.1.
An initial version of CWD (Current Working Directory) has been introduced in ElizaOS.
Support for dynamic plugin loading has been added to ElizaOS.
A developer shared a post titled 'just dev things'.

categories.title: ElizaOS Build Issues and Dependency Updates

content.text: A missing version was added to the package.json file to ensure proper package management.

A build failure was reported due to an argument type mismatch in `IAgentRuntime`, likely caused by version inconsistencies in dependencies. The issue appears to be related to AI model compatibility. The user inquired about the correct versions of Node.js, pnpm, and Python required for a successful build.

Another build error was reported due to issues with the Zod dependency. The error occurred during the DTS build process, preventing successful compilation. The issue was encountered when using Node.js v23.3.0 and executing a specific set of pnpm commands.

A dependency update was made to Vitest, upgrading versions from 1.4.0 to 1.6.1 and 2.1.8 to 2.1.9. The update addressed a security vulnerability (CVE-2025-24964) that allowed remote code execution via a WebSocket hijacking attack. The update also included various bug fixes and performance improvements.
Discussions are ongoing about how to fairly distribute rewards, with suggestions including giving them to partners, top contributors, or longest holders.

Development efforts have been focused on package improvements, new features, and bug fixes. Specifically, work has been done on fixing the plugin-solana-v2 package.json, setting package publish access to public, and addressing six bug fixes. A total of 32 contributors merged 15 pull requests. Major contributions include tcm390's work on merging pull requests related to model configurations, unit tests, updating endpoints, and making various code changes.

categories.title: Discord Client Version Conflict in Eliza Starter

content.text: A user reported a version conflict issue when building the Eliza starter project. The error occurs due to a mismatch between the installed version of '@elizaos/core' and the expected version in the project dependencies. The issue manifests as a TypeScript type incompatibility in 'src/clients/index.ts'.

The user resolved the issue by manually installing version '0.1.9' of '@elizaos/client-discord'. This suggests that the project's dependencies need to be updated to ensure compatibility with the latest versions.
Other sources provided were placeholders without actual chat transcripts. To generate a more detailed analysis, the actual Discord chat content is required.

categories.title: Metaphors for AI Agents and DAOs

content.text: AI agents can be thought of as 'mech suits' for humans, enhancing their capabilities and enabling them to achieve more.
A new metaphor for AI DAOs suggests that AI serves as the engine, providing power and automation, while humans act as the steering wheel, guiding decision-making and direction.

categories.title: Enhancements in Feedback Loops and Plugin Messaging

content.text: Efforts are being made to improve feedback loops by contributing through answering questions, providing constructive feedback, and onboarding new users.
A new update allows plugins to interact with MessengerManager to post messages on Telegram.

categories.title: feat: set package publish access to public

content.text: The package publish access has been set to public, making it accessible to a wider audience.
Cleanup task to remove leftover files and folders from the repository.
